thesis.description: This series of experiments is based on work done by Dickens and Greville (1933) and Elliott am Henry (1946, 2). Dickens and Greville found that depriving brain slices of both substrate and oxygen for even short periods of time at 38° caused a marked decrease in the anaerobic glycolytic activity of the slices. Three minutes of the pretreatment caused a reduction of the glycolytic activity to 37%, while twenty minutes decreased it to 11-12%. Respiration, in the meanwhile, was only inhibited to about 50% even after forty minutes of anoxia in the absence of substrate at 38°.
thesis.creator: Cross, Jean. D.
thesis.subject: Biochemistry.
thesis.title: The effects of anoxia and lack of substrate on the subsequent carbohydrate metabolism of brain tissue.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Cercospora beticola Sacc. is a necrogenic pathogene which produces brown small nearly circular spots on the foliage of table beets, sugar beets, mangolds and Swiss chard. On beet leaves the spots have a reddish-purple border, while on mangolds there is usually a pale green border around each spot. The center of the spot is grayish due to long septate conidia produced on conidiophores which come out through the stomata.
thesis.creator: Crête, René.
thesis.subject: Plant Pathology.
thesis.title: Studies on the parasitism of Cercosproa beticola Sacc.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The surgical service of a teaching hospital presents an unique opportunity for the study of the physiological and pathological response of individuals to alterations in circulating blood volume. Surgeons are frequently confronted with problems relating to the management of dehydration, massive hemorrhage, thermal and mechanical trauma and the preparation of elderly, malnourished, chronically ill patients for major operative procedures. The hemodynamic response of patients to anaesthesia and operation is an important factor determining operative mortality and morbidity rates.
thesis.creator: Coughlin, Francis. R.
thesis.subject: Experimental Surgery.
thesis.title: Blood volume determinations in surgical patients.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Sommerfeld and Maue obtained approximate wave functions for a free electron in a Coulomb field by comparing the iterated Dirac equation for this case with the corresponding relativistic Schroedinger equation. These functions are well described in Sommerfeld's book "Atombau und Spektrallinien", Vol. II, Chap. V, Section 8, and in later chapters of this book are applied to problems of photo-electric emission and Bremsstrahlung processes.
thesis.creator: Conkie, William. R.
thesis.subject: Mathematics.
thesis.title: Internal conversion in light nuclei.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: While the capacitor-start motor can produce, by the choice of a sufficiently high capacity and an appropriate effective turn ratio, a high starting torque at low starting current, the single-value capacitor -run motor offers a rather poor performance at start. Indeed, the negative sequence current can become so high as to produce excessive heating, if the capacity is not kept below certain limits. The necessity of taking a low capacity, however, results in a low starting torque. Furthermore, it is possible to design the auxiliary circuit (effective turn ratio and capacity) to give balanced operation at full load, but such a design reduces the starting torque considerably.
thesis.creator: Comsa, Radu. P.
thesis.subject: Electrical Engineering.
thesis.title: Running characteristics of the capacitor-run motor.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: This work is concerned with the study of new short-lived activities induced by proton bombardment in the McGill 100 Mev. synchro-cyclotron. (Hereafter the term cyclotron will be used.) This report is really made up of two parts. The first one deals with the observation of a new Scandium isotope and the second covers an investigation made over the isomerism island about N or P = 82 to see if there were any observable isomeric transitions with a half-life compatible with the practical range of the existing apparatus, i.e. 0.1 sec. < t < 10 sec.
thesis.creator: Cloutier, Roland.
thesis.subject: Physics.
thesis.title: Study of short-lived proton induced activities.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Neutron induced reactions in oxygen have been photographed in a Wilson cloud chamber for neutrons of energies up to 70 Mev. The apparatus is described. A detailed analysis was made of 215 stereoscopic photographs of four alpha particle stars. The evidence strongly suggested the following modes of disintegration.
thesis.creator: Clifford, Charles. E.
thesis.subject: Physics.
thesis.title: Neutron induced disintegrations in oxygen.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: At the close of the nineteenth century Lehmann and Neumann (1896) designed the genus Corynebacterium as a suitable pigeon-hole in their scheme of Bacterial classification for the organism producing the disease diphtheria and a few other organisms which were considered similar for morphological reasons. The genus consisted entirely of human and animal pathogenic or parasitic bacteria characterized by irregular, often club-like cell shapes, Gram-positive but showing irregular staining, non-acid-fast, non-motile, lacking endospores and having a predominently aerobic habitat.
thesis.creator: Cleveland, Edward. M.
thesis.subject: Bacteriology and Immunology.
thesis.title: The classification and taxonomy of the corynebacteria.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: This study was concerned with the nature of some of the factors that affect the human response to painful stimulation. Specifically, two types of pain thresholds were studied: the first was the minimal noxious stimulus intensity which the subject (S) reports as painful, and the second, the minimal noxious stimulus intensity at which S requests that stimulation cease. The specific problems investigated here arose from the studies reviewed below.
thesis.creator: Clark, James Ward.
thesis.subject: Psychology.
thesis.title: Factors Affecting Human Response to Pain Stimulation.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Livestock farmers in New Brunswick, in common with other livestock farmers, depend upon pasture to provide the bulk of the nutrients required by livestock during the summer months. Approximately one-sixth of the total occupied agricultural land in New Brunswick is devoted to pasture, a fact which makes its importance quite obvious. Notwithstanding its importance a large proportion of this pasture area has low productivity. [...]
thesis.creator: Chiasson, Thomas Charles.
thesis.subject: Agronomy.
thesis.title: the Effect of Various Increments of N, P and K on the Yield and Botanical Composition of Permanent Pastures.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Canada ranks among the leading countries of the world in the production and exportation of aluminium. In addition, Canadian enterprises operate aluminium plants in several parts of the world. It is rather surprising, therefore, to find relatively little research in Canadian universities dealing with problems in aluminium production. [...]
thesis.creator: Cherian, Kandathil Koshy.
thesis.subject: Engineering.
thesis.title: the Specific Conductance of Fused Cryolite-Alumina Baths.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: This thesis is an attempt to show the manner in which the early Tudors exerted an influence in Scotland from the death of James III in 1488 to the assumption of power by James V in 1524. From evidence derived from both the primary and secondary sources the author has endeavoured to trace the spasmodic but steady growth of English influence throughout this period, which ends in 1524 with the departure of the Duke of Albany, the pro-French Regent and the subsequent triumph of Tudor designs on Scotland.
thesis.creator: Charteris, Joan.
thesis.subject: History.
thesis.title: Tudor Dealings in Scotland Between 1488-1524.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The discovery of fission by Hahn and Strassman in 1939 resulted directly from the discovery of the neutron by Chadwick in 1932. Fermi and his co-workers found that, when many elements were bombarded with neutrons, some of the neutrons were captured by the nucleus of the element. This resulted in an unstable nucleus which regained stability by emitting a β-particle, sometimes accompanied by gamma rays, giving a nucleus of atomic number one unit greater than the original one bombarded. [...]
thesis.creator: Carruthers, Errol W.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: the Fission Yield of Mo99 in the Thermal Neutron Fission of U235.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The pioneer work in the field of in vivo studies of the corticosteroids present in adrenal venous blood vas carried out by Vogt (1943). She collected the adrenal venous blood from a heparinized dog and tested the blood plasma for cortical activity by biological aasay and found that adrenal glands produce large amounts of material with corticoid activity relative to the amount extractable from the tissue.
thesis.creator: Cann, Malcolm C.
thesis.subject: Biochemistry.
thesis.title: Interconversion Reactions of Desoxycorticosterone Acetate-21-c14 by the Adrenal Cortex.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The purpose of this thesis is essentially a delineation of the climatic history of the Near East, particularly recent geological and historical times. The area here considered under the term 'Near East' comprises Asia Minor, Persia, the Arabian Peninsula and Egypt. On the other hand, the time span designated by 'recent geological time' and 'historical time' are taken to mean the period 10,000 - 500 B.C., and 500 B.C. to the present respectively. For the former period, the evidence used is almost exclusively derived from geology, whereas historical sources supplement the geological and allied evidence for the latter.
thesis.creator: Butzer, Karl Wilhelm.
thesis.subject: Meteorology.
thesis.title: Some Aspects pf Postglacial Climatic Variation in the Near East Considered in Relation to Movements of Population.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The purpose of this study was to construct and standardize a short individual performance test of intelligence for children and adults living in isolated or restricted environments. It had been noted by Canadian Army Personnel Selection during World War II that an unusually high proportion of individuals from outlying rural areas in Canada made scores on service tests below the set selection standards. A non-verbal section of the general selection test was used to attempt to discriminate between these individuals on the assumption that the non-verbal material used was appropriate for assessing the abilities of individuals from such isolated or restricted areas. [...]
thesis.creator: Burnett, Alastair.
thesis.subject: Psychology.
thesis.title: Assessment of Intelligence in a Restricted Environment.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The motivation of this work lies in the hope that there may exist some possibly significant connection between the structure of a (finite) group and the structure of its associated cohomology groups. l use the word "hope", since to the present so little work has been done along these lines that one cannot accurately judge of what use the cohomology theory may be in abstract group theory. Perhaps the outstanding reason for this lack of results is due to the extreme difficulty of effectively calculating the cohomology structure of a given abstract group. So it is to the problem of effective computation that this thesis will be mainly devoted.
thesis.creator: Burgoyne, N.
thesis.subject: Mathematics.
thesis.title: Cohomology Theory in Abstract Groups.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The behaviour of electrolytic solutions is to-date not well understood. It is universally accepted that when a solute capable of forming a conducting solution is dissolved in a suitable solvent, it dissociates spontaneously into ions. The phenomena of electrolytic conduction have provided us with the most powerful arguments in favor of this ion concept, but, at the same time have provided much conflicting evidence with regard to the degree of dissociation. [...]
thesis.creator: Bulani, Walter.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: the Electrical Conductance of Some Quaternary Ammonium Halides in Solution.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: On estime que 48,000 enfants soldats ont été impliques dans la violente guerre civile en Sierra Leone entre 1991 et 2002.11 est suggéré que prés de 12,000 d'entre eux étaient des filles. Avec des lacunes importantes au niveau matériel et faisant face a d'autres problèmes d'ordre structurel, la majorité de ces filles ont eu besoin d'une certaine forme d'assistance post-conflit. Bien que l'aide internationale ait été importante, seulement 500 filles ont été inscrites au programme national de Désarmement, démobilisation et réinsertion (DDR). Les autres filles ont suivies différents parcours. La théorie de structuration de Giddens offre un cadre théorique utile pour étudier les raisons de leur absence dans le programme car il permet de focaliser sur le rôle de la structure et de I' agence dans la compréhension du comportement. La stigmatisation sociale et une inégalité de genre au sein du programme de DDR, situe dans une structure plus généralisée d'inégalité de genre, sont identifiées comme étant les problèmes principaux .

An estimated 48,000 child soldiers were involved in the violent civil war in Sierra Leone between 1991 and 2002. It is suggested that approximately 12,000 were girls. Lacking material possessions and facing other negative structural factors, the majority was in need of some form of assistance post-conflict. Although international aid response was substantial, only 500 girls entered the countrywide Disarmament, Demobilization and Reintegration (DDR) program. The remainder followed a variety of different courses. Giddens' structuration theory offers a useful theoretical framework to explore the reasons for their absence in the program, as it permits a focus on the role of structure and agencyin understanding behaviour. Social stigmatization and a gender-biased DDR program, within a broader structure of gender inequality, are identified as the principal problems .
thesis.creator: Jones, Lindsay
thesis.subject: Child soldiers -- Sierra Leone.
Women and war -- Sierra Leone.
Sierra Leone -- History -- Civil War, 1991-2002.
thesis.title: The marginalization of girl soldiers in Sierra Leone’s Disarmament, Demobilization and Reintegration program : an analysis based on structuration theory
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: L'anxiété de performance est vécue par plusieurs musiciens et serait déjà enracinée chez certains apprentis musiciens des l' âge de huit ans. Bien que plusieurs chercheurs considèrent qu'il s'agit la d'un phénomène acquis, se développant pendant l'enfance, ses premières manifestations n'ont jamais été étudiées. L'objectif de cette recherche est donc de documenter l'existence du stress lie a la performance musicale chez les très jeunes enfants.[...]

Performance anxiety is a common experience for many musicians, firmly engrained in them by the age of eight. While it has been suggested throughout the literature that this is a learned condition developed during childhood, its appearances in younger children have not yet been studied. The purpose of this study was to document the performance experiences of very young children with respect to performance anxiety.[...]
thesis.creator: Boucher, Hélène
thesis.subject: Anxiety in children.
Music -- Performance -- Psychological aspects.
thesis.title: The occurrence of music performance anxiety in early childhood
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Much progress has been made in the study of chemical kinetics on the basis that many reaction mechanisms involve the participation of 'free radicals'. In such mechanisms the overall reaction is assumed to consist of a recurring series, or 'chain', of elementary reactions which can be initiated and propagated by stable but very reactive fragments of molecules, or radicals.
thesis.creator: Brody, Harry.
thesis.subject: Physical Chemistry.
thesis.title: Effect of Hydrogen Cyanide on the Reaction of Active Nitrogen with Methyl Chloride.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The changes in the blood of pregnant women have fascinated many obstetricians and hematologists. A high incidence ot anemia has been observed in pregnancy throughout history. Moreover it has been acknowledged that the study of the blood may contribute to the establishment of a proper diagnosis and satisfactory treatment in many disorders of pregnancy.
thesis.creator: Bramlage, Catherina A.A.
thesis.subject: Experimental Medicine.
thesis.title: the Bone Marrow in Pregnancy and the Puerperium.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The project is an exploratory study into the living experiences of 25 immigrant families, with dependent children, during their first two years in Montreal. The years of immigration were from 1951 to 1953. The sample was located through the co-operation of the Protestant and Catholic school boards of Montreal. An "open-end" home interview was the main research tool. [...]

Borossa, Charles
Lobley, Prudence
Marcus, Lotte
Meislova, Jana
Morganstern, Relly

thesis.title: Their First Years in Canada.

thesis.description: The main work of this paper is the description of electronic equipment that has been developed to measure the parameters of junction transistors over an appreciable frequency range and with changing bias points.

thesis.description: In most studies of the Mannich condensation, compounds containing active hydrogens on carbon were used. Only a few reactions using compounds possessing active hydrogens on nitrogen have been reported in the literature. The objective of this work was to carry out a systematic study of the Mannich condensation of secondary amines and formaldehyde with compounds containing one or two imino groups in which the hydrogens were activated for this type of reaction by the presence of carbonyl groups. [...]
thesis.creator: Bombardieri, Caurino Cesar.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: the Study of the Mannich Condensation of Compounds Containing the Acidic -NH- Group.
